fields.name: Calm Breathing for Anxiety
fields.description: A gentle breathing exercise designed to calm racing thoughts and reduce anxiety symptoms.
instructions: Find a comfortable seated position with your back straight but relaxed.
Close your eyes or soften your gaze downward.
Take a deep breath in through your nose for 4 counts.
Hold your breath gently for 4 counts.
Exhale slowly through your mouth for 6 counts.
Repeat this cycle for the duration of the meditation.

fields.name: Loving-Kindness for Depression
fields.description: Cultivate self-compassion and connection to counter depressive thoughts and isolation.
instructions: Begin by finding a comfortable position and closing your eyes.
Place your hand on your heart and feel the gentle pressure.
Start by offering loving-kindness to yourself: 'May I be happy. May I be healthy. May I be safe. May I live with ease.'
Next, think of someone you love easily and extend the same wishes to them.
Then include a neutral person, someone you neither like nor dislike.
Finally, extend these wishes to all beings everywhere.
If difficult emotions arise, return to offering kindness to yourself.

fields.name: Progressive Body Scan for Stress
fields.description: Systematically release tension throughout your body to relieve stress and promote relaxation.
instructions: Lie down in a comfortable position with arms at your sides.
Close your eyes and take three deep breaths.
Begin with your toes, noticing any sensations without judgment.
Consciously relax your toes, then move to your feet.
Continue this process up through your legs, torso, arms, and head.
Spend about 30 seconds on each body part.
If you notice tension, breathe into that area and let it soften.
End by feeling your whole body relaxed and at ease.

fields.name: Mindful Movement for Anger
fields.description: Channel intense emotions through gentle, mindful movement to find balance and calm.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, knees slightly bent.
Begin by shaking your hands gently, then more vigorously.
Let the shaking move up your arms and through your whole body.
After 2 minutes, slow down and come to stillness.
Place your hands on your belly and take 5 deep breaths.
Begin slow, flowing arm movements, like moving through water.
Focus on the sensations of movement rather than thoughts.
End in stillness, noticing how your body feels now.

fields.name: Zen Breathing for Focus
fields.description: Traditional Zen meditation to sharpen concentration and mental clarity.
instructions: Sit in a comfortable upright position, either cross-legged or in a chair.
Keep your eyes half-open with a soft downward gaze.
Place your dominant hand on top of the other, thumbs lightly touching.
Begin counting your breaths: inhale (1), exhale (2), up to 10, then start again.
When you lose count, simply return to 1 without judgment.
After 10 minutes, stop counting and just follow the breath.
If thoughts arise, acknowledge them and return to the breath.
Maintain this focused awareness for the remainder of the session.

fields.name: Body Scan for Deep Relaxation
fields.description: A systematic journey through your body to release tension and promote deep relaxation. Perfect for stress relief and better sleep.
instructions: Find a comfortable position lying on your back
Close your eyes and take three deep breaths
Begin by bringing attention to your toes
Notice any sensations without trying to change them
Slowly move your attention up through your feet
Continue through ankles, calves, knees, and thighs
Observe your hips, lower back, and abdomen
Move through your chest, shoulders, and arms
Finally, scan your neck, face, and head
Rest in whole-body awareness for a few minutes
fields.instructor_bio: Clinical psychologist specializing in mindfulness-based stress reduction

fields.name: 4-7-8 Breathing for Instant Calm
fields.description: Dr. Andrew Weil's powerful breathing technique that acts as a natural tranquilizer for the nervous system.
instructions: Sit comfortably with your back straight
Place the tip of your tongue against the ridge behind your upper front teeth
Exhale completely through your mouth, making a whoosh sound
Close your mouth and inhale quietly through your nose for 4 counts
Exhale completely through your mouth for 8 counts
This is one breath cycle - repeat 3 more times for 4 cycles total
Practice twice daily for best results

fields.name: Walking Meditation in Nature
fields.description: Transform your daily walk into a mindfulness practice. Connect with nature while cultivating present-moment awareness.
instructions: Find a quiet path in nature or a peaceful area
Begin walking at a slower pace than usual
Focus on the sensation of your feet touching the ground
Notice the movement of your legs and the rhythm of your steps
Expand awareness to include sounds around you
Observe trees, plants, or sky without labeling
When mind wanders, gently return to the sensation of walking
Pause occasionally to take in your surroundings fully
End by standing still and taking three mindful breaths

fields.name: RAIN Meditation for Difficult Emotions
fields.description: A powerful practice for working with challenging emotions using the RAIN technique: Recognize, Allow, Investigate, Nurture.
instructions: Sit comfortably and close your eyes
Bring to mind a difficult emotion or situation
ALLOW: Let the experience be here without resistance
INVESTIGATE: Explore how it feels in your body with kindness
NURTURE: Offer yourself compassion and care
Rest in this self-compassion for several minutes
Notice any shifts in your experience
End by placing hand on heart and offering kind wishes

fields.name: Yoga Nidra for Deep Rest
fields.description: Experience yogic sleep - a state of conscious deep rest that rejuvenates body and mind. One session equals hours of regular sleep.
instructions: Lie down comfortably on your back
Set an intention (sankalpa) for your practice
Follow guided awareness through body parts
Slowly transition back to waking state
Take time to integrate before moving

fields.name: Box Breathing for Focus
fields.description: Used by Navy SEALs and first responders to maintain calm under pressure. Perfect for improving focus and reducing stress.
instructions: Sit upright in a comfortable position
Exhale completely to empty your lungs

fields.name: Metta (Loving-Kindness) Practice
fields.description: Ancient Buddhist practice scientifically proven to increase empathy, reduce implicit bias, and improve relationships.
instructions: Sit comfortably and close your eyes
Begin by offering loving-kindness to yourself
Repeat: 'May I be happy, may I be healthy, may I be safe, may I live with ease'
Bring to mind someone you love easily
Think of a neutral person and extend wishes
Include a difficult person if possible
Rest in the feeling of universal love

fields.name: Mindful Eating Meditation
fields.description: Transform your relationship with food through mindful awareness. Reduce overeating and increase satisfaction.
instructions: Choose a small piece of food (raisin, chocolate, fruit)
Examine it with curiosity as if seeing for first time
Smell the food and notice any responses
Place it in your mouth without chewing
Follow the food as you swallow

fields.name: Mountain Meditation for Stability
fields.description: Cultivate inner strength and stability by embodying the qualities of a mountain. Weather life's storms with equanimity.
instructions: Sit tall with dignity like a mountain
Visualize a mountain you find beautiful
Notice its massive base rooted in earth
See its peak reaching toward sky
Remain stable as weather changes around you

fields.name: Tonglen (Taking and Giving)
fields.description: Tibetan Buddhist practice for transforming suffering into compassion. Breathe in pain, breathe out relief.
instructions: Start with flash of openness (empty mind)
Apply to your own pain first
Include all beings with similar pain
End by dedicating merit to all beings

fields.name: Sound Bath Meditation
fields.description: Immerse yourself in healing frequencies from Tibetan bowls, gongs, and chimes. No effort required - just receive.
instructions: Lie down comfortably with eyes closed
Allow sounds to guide your awareness

fields.name: Chakra Balancing Journey
fields.description: Balance your seven energy centers through visualization and affirmation. Restore energetic harmony and vitality.
instructions: Begin at root chakra (base of spine)
Visualize red spinning wheel of light
Visualize all chakras aligned and bright

fields.name: Trataka (Candle Gazing)
fields.description: Ancient yogic practice using candle flame to develop laser-like focus and clear the mind. Enhances vision and concentration.
instructions: Place lit candle at eye level, arm's length away
Gaze softly at flame without blinking
When eyes water, close them gently
When image fades, open eyes and repeat

fields.name: Qi Gong Moving Meditation
fields.description: Gentle Chinese energy practice combining breath, movement, and intention. Cultivate life force energy (Qi).
instructions: Focus on energy flow in body
End by storing energy in lower belly

fields.name: Coherent Breathing for Heart-Brain Balance
fields.description: Breathe at the optimal rate of 5 breaths per minute to synchronize heart and brain for maximum coherence.
instructions: Focus on heart area while breathing

fields.name: Forest Bathing (Shinrin-Yoku)
fields.description: Japanese practice of mindful immersion in forest atmosphere. Scientifically proven to boost immune function and mood.
instructions: Find a natural forest or park setting
Practice 'soft gaze' taking in whole scene

fields.name: Wim Hof Breathing Method
fields.description: Powerful breathing technique to alkalize body, boost energy, and strengthen immune system. Not for pregnant women.
instructions: WARNING: Practice sitting or lying down, never in water
Take 30 deep breaths: fully in, let go (not fully out)
Breathe faster than normal but stay relaxed
After 30 breaths, exhale and hold empty

fields.name: Zazen (Just Sitting)
fields.description: The heart of Zen Buddhism - sitting without goal or technique. Simply being present with what is.
instructions: Sit in stable posture (lotus, half-lotus, or chair)
Hands in cosmic mudra (oval in lap)
When thoughts arise, acknowledge and release
No goal, no attainment, just this moment

fields.name: Inner Child Healing Meditation
fields.description: Connect with and heal your inner child through guided visualization and self-compassion. Transform old wounds into wisdom.
instructions: Sit comfortably and close your eyes
Visualize yourself as a young child
See this child clearly - notice details
Ask what they need to hear
Give them the love they needed
Promise to care for them always

fields.name: Nadi Shodhana (Alternate Nostril Breathing)
fields.description: Ancient yogic practice to balance left and right brain hemispheres. Creates mental clarity and emotional balance.
instructions: Use right thumb for right nostril
Use right ring finger for left nostril

fields.name: Gratitude Practice for Joy
fields.description: Scientifically proven practice to rewire brain for positivity. Increase happiness and life satisfaction through gratitude.
instructions: Bring to mind 3 things you're grateful for
Start with simple things (breath, sight, etc)
Feel the gratitude in your body
Expand to people in your life
Write down your gratitudes if desired
End by feeling grateful for this moment
Carry this feeling into your day

fields.name: Mindfulness of Mind
fields.description: Fourth foundation of mindfulness - observe the nature of consciousness itself. Develop meta-awareness and wisdom.
instructions: Notice awareness that knows all experience
Observe how all phenomena arise and pass
Cultivate equanimity toward all mental states

fields.name: Emotional Freedom Technique (EFT Tapping)
fields.description: Combine ancient Chinese acupressure with modern psychology. Tap on meridian points while addressing emotional issues.
instructions: Identify specific issue and rate intensity 0-10
Create setup statement: 'Even though I [issue], I deeply love and accept myself'
Tap karate chop point while saying setup 3x
Tap sequence: top of head, eyebrow, side of eye, under eye, under nose, chin, collarbone, under arm
While tapping each point, state the problem
Take deep breath and reassess intensity

fields.name: Mantra Meditation - Om Mani Padme Hum
fields.description: Tibetan Buddhist mantra of compassion. Each syllable purifies a realm of existence and develops wisdom.
instructions: Begin chanting: Om Mani Padme Hum
If using mala beads, one repetition per bead
When mind wanders, return to mantra

fields.name: Mindful Tech Detox
fields.description: Reset your relationship with technology through mindful awareness. Perfect for digital overwhelm and screen fatigue.
instructions: Turn off all devices or put in another room
Sit comfortably and notice any anxiety
Observe urges to check phone without acting
Reflect on your tech habits without judgment
Set intention for mindful tech use

fields.name: Sleep Story - Peaceful Mountain Lake
fields.description: Drift into peaceful sleep with this calming bedtime story. Journey to a serene mountain lake under starlight.
instructions: Lie comfortably in bed, ready for sleep
Close eyes and take slow, deep breaths
Imagine walking down a forest path at dusk
Smell pine trees and fresh mountain air
Arrive at crystal clear mountain lake
See stars reflecting on still water
Feel soft grass beneath you as you rest
Listen to gentle lapping of waves
Let story carry you into dreams

fields.name: Laughter Meditation
fields.description: Therapeutic laughter practice to release stress and boost mood. No jokes needed - just willingness to play!
instructions: Try different types: belly laugh, giggle, snort
If in group, make eye contact and laugh together
Notice lightness in body and mind

fields.name: Centering Prayer
fields.description: Christian contemplative practice to rest in God's presence beyond thoughts and words. A path to divine union.
instructions: Choose a sacred word (Love, Peace, Jesus, etc)
When thoughts arise, gently return to word
Don't repeat mechanically - let it be gentle
Rest in God's presence between thoughts
If drawn into thoughts, return to word
At end, remain in silence 2 minutes

fields.name: Mirror Gazing for Self-Love
fields.description: Powerful practice to develop self-love and acceptance through mindful mirror gazing. Transform your self-image.
instructions: Begin with eyes closed, breathing deeply
Open eyes and gaze softly at yourself
Look into your own eyes with kindness
Notice critical thoughts without believing them
'I see you', 'I love you', 'You are enough'
If emotions arise, breathe and continue
End by placing hand on heart

fields.name: Five Rhythms Movement
fields.description: Dance through five universal rhythms - flowing, staccato, chaos, lyrical, stillness. A moving meditation for emotional release.
instructions: Create safe space to move freely
Begin with FLOWING - continuous, smooth movements
Shift to STACCATO - angular, direct movements
Enter CHAOS - release control, let body move wildly
End in STILLNESS - come to rest
No right or wrong way to move

fields.name: Worry Time Box
fields.description: Contain anxious thoughts by scheduling specific worry time. Paradoxically reduces anxiety by giving it boundaries.
instructions: Don't try to solve - just acknowledge
If worries arise later, note them for tomorrow

fields.name: Earthing Meditation
fields.description: Connect directly with Earth's healing energy. Practice barefoot on grass or sand for maximum benefit.
instructions: Stand or sit with bare feet on earth

fields.name: Ho'oponopono Forgiveness
fields.description: Hawaiian practice of reconciliation and forgiveness. Heal relationships and clear negative energy with four simple phrases.
instructions: Bring to mind person or situation needing healing
Feel the energy of each phrase

fields.name: Quantum Pause Breathing
fields.description: Access expanded states of consciousness through specific breath holds. Not for those with blood pressure issues.
instructions: On holds, go into quantum field

fields.name: Mindful Photography Walk
fields.description: Combine mindfulness with creative expression. Use camera or phone to capture present-moment beauty.
instructions: Take camera or phone on walk
Pause when something speaks to you
Between shots, return to walking meditation

fields.name: Somatic Trauma Release
fields.description: Gently release stored trauma from the body through mindful movement and shaking. Based on Peter Levine's work.
instructions: Notice any tension or holding in body
If emotions arise, breathe and allow

fields.name: Color Breathing for Chakras
fields.description: Breathe healing colors into each chakra. Balance your energy system through chromotherapy and visualization.
instructions: Breathe red light into root chakra
End with white light through all chakras

fields.name: Mindful Parenting Pause
fields.description: Quick reset for parents in challenging moments. Find calm center before responding to children.
instructions: Remember: they're having hard time, not giving you one
Connect with love for your child

fields.name: Sacred Pause Between Activities
fields.description: Transform transitions into moments of presence. Create sacred pauses between daily activities.

fields.name: Moon Gazing Meditation
fields.description: Ancient practice of moon gazing for emotional balance and feminine energy. Best during full moon.
instructions: Find comfortable spot to view moon
Sit or lie down facing moon
Notice how moonlight feels on skin
Allow emotions to surface and release
End by bowing to moon in gratitude

fields.name: Workplace Stress Reset
fields.description: Discreet stress relief for the office. Reset your nervous system without leaving your desk.
instructions: Sit upright in chair, feet flat
Gently stretch neck side to side

fields.name: Grief Meditation - Healing the Heart
fields.description: Gentle practice for processing grief and loss. Honor your feelings while finding peace.
instructions: Breathe into the ache in your heart
Feel their love returning to you
Rest in the eternal nature of love

fields.name: Athletic Performance Visualization
fields.description: Mental training used by Olympic athletes. Visualize perfect performance to enhance actual results.

fields.name: Third Eye Activation
fields.description: Awaken your inner vision and intuition through focused third eye meditation. May cause tingling sensations.
instructions: Close eyes and focus on third eye point

fields.name: Bedtime Body Scan for Kids
fields.description: Help children relax for sleep with this playful body scan. Perfect for ages 4-12.
instructions: Imagine a sleepy star visiting your body
Star touches your toes - they feel heavy
Moves to feet - they relax and sink
Up through legs - like cooked spaghetti

fields.name: Coffee Meditation
fields.description: Transform your morning coffee into a mindfulness ritual. Perfect for busy people who 'don't have time to meditate'.
instructions: Prepare coffee mindfully, noticing each step
Hold warm cup, feeling heat in palms
Notice the color and steam patterns
Drink entire cup with full presence
End with gratitude for this moment
